intro: Galium heldreichii f. lovcense, commonly known as the Lovcenski bedstraw, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale pink. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
